author: sky.cactus
content:
Anyone have strong opinions of the two following options:
1. Continue enforcing very strict editing rules that are frustrating some people and bogging down the EIP process.
2. Greatly relax the editing rules, and accept more low quality EIPs making it through the process.

author: sky.cactus
content: There is no middle ground option because the middle ground requires more time than the editors have available at the moment.  Fuzzy rules are very time consuming to enforce so given limited resources we have to choose between overly strict rules or removing some rules.

author: sky.cactus
content: I would like to get a short term resolution on this so we can get some core EIPs unstuck.

author: sky.cactus
content:
Separately: It appears that EIP-1 and the template don't match (unsurprising).  EIP-1 makes no mention of the Simple Summary section while the template does.
<https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1#what-belongs-in-a-successful-eip>
<https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ethereum/EIPs/master/eip-template.md>

It was removed from EIP-1 in this PR:
<https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/2186>

author: sky.cactus
content: Only reason I am weakly arguing in favor of fixing EIP-1 to match the the template rather than the other way around is because I have been enforcing the inclusion of the Simple Summary for quite a while (close to a year) and since the PR to remove the Simple Summary we have gotten much better at Defining what should be in the Simple Summary vs what should be in the Abstract.

author: sky.cactus
content: That is to say, I think if we were to have the discussion in that PR again, it would go the other way.
